com.rds_software.customers.menarini.projects.odp.backend.repos.csv

Class CsvOdpRepository

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.rds_software.customers.menarini.projects.odp.backend.repos.csv.CsvOdpRepository
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IOdpRepository

    public class CsvOdpRepository
extends Object
implements IOdpRepository
    CSV-based implementation of the ODP repository. Stores ODP data in CSV files within a configured folder.

    CSV files used:

    • odps.csv - Main ODP records
    • authorization_flows.csv - Authorization steps (stores userId as foreign key)
    • companies.csv - Company reference data
    • user_companies.csv - User-to-company mappings
    • user_roles.csv - User-to-role mappings (referenced by authorization_flows.csv)

    Note: User roles are normalized into a separate file (user_roles.csv) to avoid redundancy. The authorization_flows.csv file stores only the userId, and the role is looked up from user_roles.csv when loading authorization flows.

    Author:
    Claude Code

      • nextApprover

        public OdpUser nextApprover(Odp odp)
        Description copied from interface: IOdpRepository
        Determines the next approver for an ODP based on its current state.

        This method identifies which user (and their role) should be assigned to approve the ODP when it transitions from its current state to the next approval state in the workflow. The approval workflow is:

        • Current state: DRAFT â†’ Returns user with role SIGNER_1
        • Current state: WAITING_AUTH_SIGNER_1 â†’ Returns user with role PAYER (skips SIGNER_2)
        • Current state: WAITING_AUTH_PAYER â†’ No further approver needed (throws exception)

        Important: This method only determines the next approver; it does not modify the ODP state. The actual state transition is performed by the caller using the returned user's role to derive the new state via OdpUtils.getWaitingStateForRole(com.rds_software.customers.menarini.projects.odp.types.RoleType).

        The returned user is looked up from the user-role mappings available in the system.

        Specified by:
        nextApprover in interface IOdpRepository
        Parameters:
        odp - the ODP to determine the next approver for
        Returns:
        the user (with their role) who should approve the next authorization step

      • addAuthorizationStep

        public boolean addAuthorizationStep(String id,
                                    String password,
                                    OdpAuthorizationStep step)
        Adds an authorization step to the ODP's authorization flow and updates the ODP state and assignee.

        This method performs the following operations atomically:

        1. Validates the provided password against the user's credentials
        2. Appends the authorization step to the ODP's authorization flow
        3. Updates the ODP's state based on the authorization result
        4. Updates the ODP's assignee to the next approver (if approved) or keeps the current assignee (if rejected)

        State transitions occur as follows:

        • If the step is approved, the ODP advances to the next state in the workflow, determined by calling IOdpRepository.nextApprover(Odp) to get the next user and deriving the state from their role
        • If the step is rejected, the ODP transitions to OdpStateType.REJECTED while keeping the current assignee unchanged
        Specified by:
        addAuthorizationStep in interface IOdpRepository
        Parameters:
        id - the unique identifier of the ODP
        password - the user's password for authentication
        step - the authorization step to add
        Returns:
        true if the authorization step was added successfully, false if password validation failed

      • retrieveOdpUser

        public OdpUser retrieveOdpUser(String userId)
        Retrieves an OdpUser object by looking up the user's role from the user-role mapping data source (e.g., user_roles.csv).

        This method constructs an OdpUser instance by querying the user-role mapping to find the role associated with the specified user ID.

        Specified by:
        retrieveOdpUser in interface IOdpRepository
        Parameters:
        userId - the unique identifier of the user to retrieve
        Returns:
        the OdpUser with the user ID and associated role
